CITIGROUP INC. Current Report on Form 8-K Item 5.02. Departure
of Directors or Certain Officers; Election of Directors;
Appointment of Certain Officers; Compensatory Arrangements of
Certain Officers. On September 22, 2020, Johnbull Okpara agreed
to become Controller and Chief Accounting Officer of Citigroup
Inc. (Citi), effective as of the date that he is released from
certain commitments to his current employer. Mr. Okpara, 49, has
been Managing Director, Global Head of Financial Planning and
Analysis and Chief Financial Officer, Infrastructure Groups at
Morgan Stanley since 2016. Prior to that, Mr. Okpara was
Managing Vice President, Finance and Deputy Controller at
Capital One Financial Corporation. Mr. Okpara will be paid a
base salary at the rate of $475,000 per year and will receive a
bonus for 2020 of $3,525,000. In addition, Mr. Okpara will
receive replacement deferred equity and cash awards in the
aggregate amount of $1,022,755, which awards will vest over the
period through January 2023. Mr. Okpara will be eligible for
discretionary incentive compensation and benefits in accordance
with Citi’s plans and policies. Item 8.01 Other Events. Mr.
Okpara will replace Jeff Walsh, who will retire from the
position of interim Controller and Chief Accounting Officer.
Citi intends to file a Form 8-K on or after the date Mr. Walsh
retires as Citi’s principal accounting officer. Item 9.01
Financial Statements and Exhibits. (d) Exhibits.
